title: Should I Bother Doing This, and If So, Where To Send It?
body: So I was just in this game with a Teemo trying to ruin our fun, and he said something implying that it was purposeful. He went top with me, and then when I went bot to try to help the lane he just followed and went where he would benefit us the least(we were doing horribly because we had {{champion:90}} mid, {{champion:11}} jg, me({{champion:92}} top and it was my first game as her), {{champion:17}} nowhere, {{champion:13}} bot and we were just shuffling lanes around. He also just went invis and sat a lot. Anyway, when he typed the comment in the chat- it was exactly "is it cause i ruined your game and no matter what you say there is not a god * thing you can do about it"- I screenshotted it, and I am asking is there any point to sending this, will Riot do anything, and where do I send the image if you think so? I could really care less if this guy gets banned, but I see people complaining about people ruining games, so I thought I'd try at least. Also, I believe the reason we were doing badly was because it was basically 4v5, and they had no jg and some really tanky characters, not our team itself.

replies.body:
Hey BBKong,

For offenses that occur in game, do your best to use the report systems in the post-game lobby. It makes players' behaviors easier to track and apply punishments to certain players if necessary.

I've heard that before, but I didn't think it would let you put a picture in the report so I wanted to know. I'll probably just keep that screenshot and let this post die, as it's not affecting me. Thanks for the reply anyway. Also, love the pic I get when I hover over your name.

By far my favorite icon! :) And I just wanted to let you know that when you report a player, it sends the pre-game lobby chat, in-game chat, and post-game lobby chat to Riot, so you don't have to worry about sending that screenshot! Riot already has access to that information!
Well that's news (I haven't been playing long, I just play other MOBAs) and really helpful. Thanks, but I didn't report him so I guess I made a big mistake.

Well, if you didn't report him via the post-game lobby, you could send a ticket to Riot Games Player Support with the screenshot; however, for future reference, try to use the post-game lobby reporting feature when you can! Here's some information on sending that report:
_____________________

For players who commit offenses outside of matches or who violate the Terms of Service but don't fall under one of the standard categories, you can send Riot a report by [submitting a ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) to Riot Games Player Support with a screenshot of the said offenses and any additional information that you'd like to add. 

If you're unsure where to put your ticket in, just select:
[*I have a question about League of Legends/Riot Games.*] > [*Game and Features*] > [*General Questions*]

Thank you for your diligence.

Hey BBkong,

We have all been in situations with toxic, troll like players and the best thing we can do at this point is report them so Riot can look into it and take the necessary steps. If I may give some advice as well when it comes to negative players, and it made seem a bit hard to chew. Don't let negative players get to you. Easier said than done, I know, but think of each game as not only a way to team build but to work and hone your skills. I used to get so raged up I would walk away from my computer but I had to realize no matter how negative they were they really had no effect on me up close and in person.

 Try to stay positive and remember to report toxic players so we can help Riot curb negativity in and out of game!
